briefdescription.para: Default constructor. Initializes argument to an empty std::vector.
Initializes argument to operands (copy each element)

parameterdescription.para: Operands of the sum, copied in the object.

briefdescription.para: Creates the sum of & leftOperand and rightOperand.
Gives the type of a Sum object.

simplesect.para: True if the expression is indexed.
False else.
The numerical factor of the sum.
The sum divided by its factor.

briefdescription.para: Returns all the possible factors.

simplesect.para: The concatenation of all possible factors for the arguments.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the real part of the Abstract and returns it.

simplesect.para: The real part of the Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the imaginary part of the Abstract and returns it.

simplesect.para: The imaginary part of the Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the modulus in the complex plane of the Abstract and returns it.

simplesect.para: The modulus part of the Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the argument in the complex plane of the Abstract and returns it.

simplesect.para: The argument part of the Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Inserts an expression in a sum or a product.

detaileddescription.para:
Allows to insert an element in a sum or product without comparing all existing terms. This saves time when inserting element by element. The side parameter allows to insert to the left (side = 0) or to the right (side = 1) in products (useful when considering non commutating expressions.
expr
Expression to insert.
side
Side of insertion for Prod expressions.

memberdef.argsstring: (int mode=0, std::ostream &out=std::cout, LibraryMode libMode=LibraryMode::NoLib) const override
memberdef.name: print

briefdescription.para: Displays the abstract in standard output.

parameterdescription.para: Tells if the Abstract is printed alone (default) or in another expr.

briefdescription.para: Creates a LaTeX output for the Abstract.

parameterdescription.para: Tells if the Abstract is printed alone (default) or in another expr.

simplesect.para: The string corresponding to the LaTeX output.

briefdescription.para: Return the sum of all the arguments.

simplesect.para: The sum of the scalar evaluation of all the arguments.
For this function to be justified, all the arguments must be scalar and real.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates the Abstract.

detaileddescription.para:
Replaces all variables by their value and evaluating. This function must be used instead of evaluateScalar() when treating not only real scalars.* In particular (x=2, y=3) x+iy evaluates to 3+ 3i whereas evaluateScalar() would return 3.
The abstract result of the evaluation.

briefdescription.para: Merge identical terms.

detaileddescription.para:
When identical terms (identical to a numerical factor) appear this function merge them in the same term. Example: x+y+2*x -> 3*x+y.
True if terms have been merged.
False else.

briefdescription.para: Derives the sum.

simplesect.para: The sum of the derivatives of the arguments

briefdescription.para: Factors the expr if common factors are found.

parameterdescription.para: If true factors recursively all the arguments.

briefdescription.para: Factors the expr by expr if it is a common factor.

parameterdescription.para: If true factors recursively all the arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< Expr > const &factors, bool full) const override
memberdef.name: collect

briefdescription.para: Collects terms in sum according to some factors given by the user.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows the factor with some specific scalar variables. For example, $ ax + ay + by $ can be factored in two ways. Either with $ (a, b) $ which gives $ a(x+y) + by $ ; or with $ (x, y) $ which gives $ ax + (a+b)y $. With the collect function it is possible to choose precisely the set of variables that will be factored to express results in a standard way.

parameterdescription.para: Factors to search in the expression.
Boolean (default = false) that tells if the collection must be recursive (full expression depth).

simplesect.para: The collected expression if modifications have been done.
std::nullopt else.
This function will probably replace the factor() function in the future.
For now, the collect function does not support factorization by indicial tensors, whereas factor() does.

briefdescription.para: Check if expr can factor *this.

detaileddescription.para:
In almost every case this corresponds just to the comparison ** *this == expr**. For Prod, Pow, Fraction types (all that are multiplicative) we must check if the factor hides in a product.
expr
Factor to search in the expression.
True if expr is a possible factor.
False else.

briefdescription.para: Remove a factor from an expr, that must have been determined before.

simplesect.para: The expr in which factor has been removed

briefdescription.para: Returns the parity property of the expression with respect to t_variable.

simplesect.para: 1 if the expression is even in t_variable.
-1 if the expression is odd in t_variable.
0 else.

briefdescription.para: Compares the Abstract with another.

detaileddescription.para:
Here if two Abstracts have the same name, the function will return true even if they are not mathematically equal. So beware not to name different things the same way.
expr
Abstract to compare.
True if the two Abstracts are the same (or have the same name).
False else.

briefdescription.para: Handles a sum, function of multiple arguments.
